basics.name: Jacob Aronoff
basics.summary: I'm from Newton, Massachusetts and have been in the Boston area for most of my life. I went to Milton Academy where I helped grow the school's programming department from 40 people to 120 people (in a school of 800). I was instrumental in the founding of the school's programming club and tutoring system. I currently attend Northeastern University where I study Computer Science. I'm very interested in tutoring, entrepreneurship, and programming (of course!) I'm part of Northeastern's NUHacks club whose mission is to help student make cool things for the purpose of making cool things (a mission near and dear to my heart.) I was recently elected a NUHacks board member.

work.summary: Feedshare is an app that allows college students to find free food around campus.
highlights: Built a cross platform mobile application in react native, swift, objective C and java

work.summary: I worked at Bitsight for two summers
highlights: Automated customer support by leveraging three seperate APIs in a microservice
Created micro services in Flask, Javascript, and Java
Helped update the company wide testing su
Added more expressive information in customer admin portal

volunteer.summary: Started the programming tutor curriculum at my high school

awards.title: Laurence S. Persky Memorial Award
awards.summary: excellence in work appearing in a Milton Academy Student Publication

awards.title: First Prize
awards.summary: I won Blueprint by making an app to help coordinate food delivery in school's

publications.name: Personal Blog
publications.summary: My personal blog where I have made numerous tutorials for beginning and advanced programmers
